topic.title: Help
topic.text: This [window](Windows) does not have a specific help topic. See [here](Help On Help) for general information on using the help system.

topic.title: Help On Help
topic.text:
The #{help} system provides comprehensive information about using the application. Topics are organized with a #{table of contents} and searchable #{index}.
To navigate the help system: - Click on [links](Help) to jump to related topics - Use the #{Contents} button to see all topics - Use the #{Index} button to search by keyword - Use the #{Search} feature to find specific text
Links are shown in a different color and can be activated by clicking with the mouse or using the Tab key to move between links and pressing Enter.

topic.title: Menus
topic.text:
#{Menus} provide access to application commands and features through the #{menu bar} at the top of the screen.
To use menus: - Click on a menu name to open it - Use #{keyboard shortcuts} (Alt+letter) to open menus - Navigate menu items with arrow keys - Press Enter to select a menu item - Press Esc to close a menu
Common menus include: - #{File} menu: Open, save, and exit operations - #{Edit} menu: Cut, copy, paste, and other editing functions - #{View} menu: Control window and display settings - #{Help} menu: Access help topics and about information

topic.title: Windows
topic.text:
#{Windows} are rectangular areas on the screen that contain application content. Each window can be moved, resized, and managed independently.
Window features: - #{Title bar}: Shows the window title and close button - #{Status bar}: Displays context information at the bottom - #{Scroll bars}: Navigate content larger than the window - #{Focus}: The active window receives keyboard input
Window operations: - #{Move}: Click and drag the title bar - #{Resize}: Click and drag the window edges or corners - #{Close}: Click the close button or press keyboard shortcut - #{Switch}: Click on a window to bring it to focus - #{Minimize}: Some windows can be minimized to the taskbar
Multiple windows can be open at the same time, and you can switch between them by clicking or using keyboard shortcuts.

topic.title: Editing Text
topic.text:
The #{text editing} [window](Windows) allows you to create and modify text files with full keyboard navigation and editing capabilities.
Navigation: - #{Arrow keys}: Move cursor character by character or line by line - #{Home}/#{End}: Jump to beginning or end of line - #{Page Up}/#{Page Down}: Scroll through the document - #{Ctrl+Home}/#{Ctrl+End}: Jump to start or end of document
Editing operations: - #{Type}: Enter text at the cursor position - #{Backspace}: Delete character before cursor - #{Delete}: Delete character at cursor - #{Cut} (Ctrl+X): Remove selected text to clipboard - #{Copy} (Ctrl+C): Copy selected text to clipboard - #{Paste} (Ctrl+V): Insert clipboard contents at cursor
Text selection: - #{Mouse}: Click and drag to select text - #{Shift+arrows}: Select text using keyboard
The editor supports #{undo} and #{redo} operations and can handle files of various sizes efficiently.

topic.title: Editing Tables
topic.text:
The #{table editing} [window](Windows) provides a spreadsheet-like interface for viewing and editing tabular data.
Navigation: - #{Arrow keys}: Move between cells - #{Tab}: Move to next cell - #{Shift+Tab}: Move to previous cell - #{Home}/#{End}: Jump to first or last cell in row - #{Page Up}/#{Page Down}: Scroll through rows
Editing cells: - #{Enter}: Start editing the current cell - #{Type}: Enter data into the cell - #{Enter}: Confirm changes and move to next row - #{Esc}: Cancel editing and restore previous value
Table operations: - #{Insert row}: Add a new row to the table - #{Delete row}: Remove the current row - #{Insert column}: Add a new column to the table - #{Delete column}: Remove the current column
The table editor supports copying and pasting data between cells and can handle large datasets efficiently.

topic.title: Terminal Window
topic.text:
The #{terminal window} provides access to a #{command-line interface} within the application, allowing you to run shell commands and interact with the underlying operating system.
Features: - #{Full terminal emulation}: Supports ANSI/VT100 sequences - #{Command execution}: Run any shell command - #{Scrollback buffer}: View previous output - #{Text selection}: Copy and paste text - #{Resizable}: Adjust window size to fit your needs
Usage: - #{Type commands}: Enter shell commands at the prompt - #{Execute}: Press Enter to run the command - #{Scroll}: Use mouse wheel or scrollbar to view history - #{Copy/Paste}: Use terminal's selection and paste features
The terminal window maintains its own shell session and environment, separate from other terminal windows you may open.
